item.title: These states will vote on abortion in 2024. And, a mysterious ant takes over NYC
item.description: Missouri and Arizona are two of the latest states to get enough signatures to add abortion rights to ballots in the November elections for voters. Plus, ManhattAnt, a mysterious ant, takes over NYC.

item.title: After 8 years of a Democratic governor in Louisiana, Landry moves policy to the right
item.description: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry, who signed the Ten Commandments law, is the first Republican governor in the state in eight years and has gotten national attention for a number of right-wing policies.

item.title: Venezuela moves to shut down dissent after a disputed election
item.description: Lawmakers aligned with Venezuela's autocratic leader Nicolas Maduro say they will pass a bill regulating social media companies. Opponents say it is a move to repress dissent.

item.title: Meta shutters tool used to fight disinformation, despite outcry
item.description: The social media company discontinues its CrowdTangle tool, which researchers have used to track misinformation. Amid fears of election interference, lawmakers have urged Meta to keep it running.

item.title: After health care attacks, tech giants will help small hospitals with cyber defenses
